business.headline: US government shutdown to end: Will it result in a rally for Sensex, Nifty?Stock market today: Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,950.5 points at 8:00 am, suggesting that the Nifty50 will open above Wednesday's closing level of 25,875.80.

Applying for a personal loan? Don't fall for these 5 common scam tacticsThe race to get fast loans has made many borrowers easy targets for fraudsters. Scammers use fake apps, urgent messages and sweet deals to trap people. Spotting the red flags can save you from serious financial trouble.

Gold prices continue to rise. Why are they climbing?After months of ups and downs, gold is once again on the rise. With fresh global triggers and growing demand, the metal is gaining strength. Here's a closer look at the factors fuelling the latest surge.

Retail inflation eases to record low of 0.25% in October as food prices fallThe latest consumer price index (CPI) print was well below expectations and marks the lowest reading since the current CPI series began in 2015, which uses 2012 as the base year.

Is your income tax refund delayed? Here's how interest is calculated on itWaiting endlessly for your tax refund can test anyone's patience. The silver lining? The government compensates you with interest for delays — at a fixed rate, calculated monthly. But there are rules, limits and exceptions. Let's decode them.
Sensex, Nifty end higher as US optimism sparks IT rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 595.19 points to close at 84,466.51, while the NSE Nifty50 added 180.85 points to end at 25,875.80.

Gold without the glitter: Why investors are moving away from physical goldIn October 2025, India recorded the third-highest gold ETF inflows globally, behind only the United States and China, a clear sign that the country's love for gold is being redefined in the digital era.

Buying a house just because you can afford the EMI? Think againThe calculator may say you can afford it, but life may say otherwise. A home loan is not just a financial decision — it impacts savings, career choices, and long-term stability.

Explained: Why Adani Enterprises shares have gained over 6% todayAdani Enterprises share price: The rise came after the company announced plans for a Rs 24,930-crore rights issue, its biggest fundraising move since the cancelled follow-on public offering (FPO) in 2023.

IndusInd Bank shares jump 5% today. What's behind the rally?At around 1:20 pm, IndusInd Bank shares were up 4.38% at Rs 862.05 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), with trading volumes remaining strong through the afternoon session.

India's direct tax collection up 7%, but refunds down 17.7%. What does it mean?India's direct tax collection climbed 7% this year, but refunds dropped 17.7%. It leaves taxpayers asking what's really driving the change.

Sensex jumps 600 points: 3 reasons why stock market is rising todayThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 663.63 points to 84,534.95, while the NSE Nifty50 jumped 196.25 points to 25,891.20 as of 11:38 am. The rally comes after days of sluggish trade.

The great IPO gamble: Why so many retail investors end up losing moneyThis is Part 1 of a three-part series examining how India's IPO boom is entering risky territory for retail investors amid sky-high valuations and growing market hype.

When income rises but wealth doesn't: Inside India's lifestyle inflation problemThe globalisation, liberalisation, and privatisation of the post 1991 – propelled GDP growth but fostered dynamics that entrench lifestyle creep at a seed level.

Groww shares list 12% higher on debut: Hold or book profit now?Groww's market debut at Rs 112 marks a strong start for the fintech, but analysts say investors should book partial profits and hold the rest for long-term growth amid valuation risks.

Groww shares list at 14% premium, exceeds expectation on market debutThe stock opened at Rs 114 on the BSE and Rs 112 on the NSE, compared to its IPO price of Rs 100 per share, exceeding market expectations for a modest gain.

Tata Motors CV shares list at 28% premium after demerger at Rs 335Tata Motors' commercial vehicle arm listed with a strong premium, reflecting investor confidence in India's transport and infrastructure growth, and marking a major milestone in the company's value-unlocking journey.

Pine Labs IPO allotment out: Check status, listing date and expected gainsInvestors who have applied for the IPO can check their allotment status through the BSE website or via the registrar, Kfin Technologies Ltd.

Gold price at Rs 1.24 lakh, silver nears Rs 1.56 lakh: What's next?The rally in precious metals comes amid expectations of a US Federal Reserve rate cut next month, easing concerns around the prolonged US government shutdown and continued weakness in the dollar index.

Tenneco Clean Air IPO opens for bidding: Check price band, GMP before subscribingTenneco Clean Air IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 3,600 crore, entirely an offer for sale (OFS) of 9.07 crore shares. This means all proceeds will go to the selling shareholders, and the company will not receive any fresh capital from the issue.

entertainment.headline: Rashmika Mandanna: Hope everyone has a Vijay Deverakonda in life, he's a blessing At the success meet of 'The Girlfriend' in Hyderabad, Rashmika Mandanna expressed gratitude to Vijay Deverakonda, referring to him as "a blessing" and sharing her hopes that everyone has such a person in their lives.

Haq box office Day 6: Emraan Hashmi-Yami Gautam's legal drama sees slight dip Emraan Hashmi and Yami Gautam's courtroom drama 'Haq' has crossed Rs 11 crore at the domestic box office after a strong opening weekend. Despite a midweek dip, steady audience turnout and positive word-of-mouth suggest the film could maintain its momentum into the second weekend.

Jennifer Aniston shares rare political stance after Jimmy Kimmel suspension Actor Jennifer Aniston responds to the suspension of 'Jimmy Kimmel Live!' by advocating for unity and the importance of voting, following controversy involving Jimmy Kimmel's remarks and subsequent network action.

Love OTP review: Aniish crafts relatable tale mixing humour, love, and toxicityRelease Date:Fri Nov 14, 2025 'Love OTP' review: Written, directed and starring Aniish, 'Love OTP' is an entertaining take on toxic relationships with relatable comedy as its strong point.

Adah Sharma: Half the country wanted to protect me, other half wanted to kill me Actor Adah Sharma spoke to IndiaToday.in about receiving death threats post 'The Kerala Story' and why she deems controversial roles necessary. She also discussed her upcoming legal thriller 'Reeta Sanyal Season 2'

Actor Taylor Zakhar Perez says Red, White & Royal Blue 2 script is really good Taylor Zakhar Perez has expressed enthusiasm for the upcoming sequel to the film 'Red, White & Royal Blue', with plans underway to begin filming in 2026. The actor confirmed the script has been well received and shared insights about the production process.

Jimmy Kimmel gets emotional paying tribute to Cleto Escobedo III. Watch Jimmy Kimmel pays homage to late-night bandleader Cleto Escobedo III, who died at the age of 59, with a heartfelt monologue and temporary pause of his programme.

Singer Adele to star in Tom Ford's directorial Cry to Heaven: Report Singer Adele will star in Tom Ford's new film, marking her acting debut in the adaptation of Anne Rice's 'Cry to Heaven', with production scheduled for January and release planned for autumn 2026.

Super Mario Galaxy Movie trailer teases Mario's space quest with Rosalina Nintendo and Illumination unveil the first look at their highly anticipated 2026 sequel, with Chris Pratt, Anya Taylor-Joy, and Jack Black returning alongside new cast members Brie Larson and Benny Safdie.

The Devil Wears Prada 2 drops teaser: Meryl Streep, Anne Hathaway return in May The sequel to the 2006 hit brings back Meryl Streep, Anne Hathaway and Emily Blunt to depict new power struggles at Runway magazine amid the decline of print journalism.

BB 19 Episode 80: Mridul evicted; Amaal-Tanya accuse Gaurav of using him as pawn 'Bigg Boss 19' saw a wave of emotional eviction as Mridul exited after the Top 10 vote pitch. The episode ended with a harsh new accusation: Amaal asserted that winner Gaurav had used Mridul as a pawn.

Vijay Deverakonda kisses Rashmika Mandanna's hand at The Girlfriend success event Vijay Deverakonda publicly kissed Rashmika Mandanna's hand at 'The Girlfriend' success event. The affectionate moment delighted fans and highlighted their strong bond.

Bhatts in a row: Mukesh slams Vikram over his remarks on exploiting Mahesh Bhatt Producer Mukesh Bhatt opens up about his separation from elder brother Mahesh Bhatt. He also addresses allegations made by director Vikram Bhatt, highlighting family tensions and misunderstandings.

Rajnath Singh, Farhan Akhtar launch My Stamp before Rezang La Battle anniversary The makers of '120 Bahadur' launched a customised 'My Stamp' based on the Rezang La War Memorial. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh unveiled the stamp in New Delhi in the presence of Farhan Akhtar, Razneesh 'Razy' Ghai and Ritesh Sidhwani.

Rashmika on her fears after backlash over men should experience period comment Actor Rashmika Mandanna faced criticism for her period pain remarks on Jagapathi Babu's talk show – 'Jayammu Nischayammu Raa'. While responding to a fan on social media, she also revealed her fear of attending shows due to constant misinterpretation of her comments.

Devi Sri Prasad hails Rashmika's The Girlfriend, says she deserves National Award Music composer Devi Sri Prasad, who gave Rashmika Mandanna chart-topping hits like 'Srivalli' and 'Peelings', has heaped praise on the actor for her latest performance in 'The Girlfriend'

Globe Trotter: Priyanka says Malti bonded with Mahesh Babu's daughter, a calf Priyanka Chopra revealed that her daughter Malti Marie had the best time with Mahesh Babu's daughter Sitara during the shoot of 'SSMB29'. The film is tentatively titled 'Globe Trotter'.

Priyanka Chopra goes guns blazing in saree: 1st look from Rajamouli's Globe Trotter SS Rajamouli shared Priyanka Chopra's first look as Mandakini from 'Globe Trotter'. The actor is seen in a fierce appearance, aiming a pistol while wearing a yellow saree.

Border 2: Varun Dhawan's march into legacy could be his battle for reinvention Varun Dhawan aims to take a strong leap with 'Border 2', playing Param Vir Chakra awardee Colonel Hoshiar Singh Dahiya. The film could mark his most defining shift as an actor yet – from mass entertainer to an intense performer.

general news.headline: DNA test confirms Dr Umar Nabi drove i20 that exploded near Red Fort Live UpdatesDNA samples taken from members of his family in Kashmir's Pulwama were later matched with human remains recovered from the car, confirming that Dr Umar was driving the Hyundai i20 when it exploded, sources said.

Train US workers, then go home: Scott Bessent explains Trump's new H-1B visa planTreasury Secretary Scott Bessent defended President Trump's visa strategy as key to reviving US manufacturing, saying it will rebuild skills in industries like shipbuilding and semiconductors after decades of outsourcing.

From Jamia to jail: Chancellor of terror-tainted Al-Falah had a shady pastAccording to a former colleague who spoke to India Today Fact Check on the condition of anonymity, Jawad became a Mechanical Engineering lecturer at Jamia Millia Islamia in 1993. But his ambitions far exceeded the humble podium of a college.

Delhi car bomber was in touch with Turkey-based handler 'Ukasa', say sourcesInvestigators say the Red Fort blast suspects were in contact with a handler codenamed "Ukasa," traced to Ankara, Turkey, who coordinated the group's movements and radicalisation through the encrypted Session app.

Sania Mirza opens up on panic attacks after Shoaib Malik divorce: I was shiveringSania Mirza has revealed she suffered panic attacks after her divorce from Shoaib Malik. The tennis star credited her close friend, Bollywood director Farah Khan, for helping her through one of her lowest emotional moments.

They don't need our help: Marco Rubio praises India's handling of Delhi blastThe US offered help in probing the deadly Delhi blast, but Secretary of State Marco Rubio praised India's capable, professional investigation, expressing confidence in its handling of the tragedy.

Actor-beti Neha Sharma a brahmastra for Congress MLA in Bhagalpur?With election season in Bihar, Bollywood actor and influencer Neha Sharma was back in Bhagalpur. She gave her Instagram feed a break from the usual film promotion, brand endorsements and travel posts and shared a Reel of a roadshow with her father, Congress MLA Ajeet Sharma. Is Neha Sharma really the "Brahmastra" and "Hukum ka ikka" for her dad?

Red Fort bomber Dr Umar visited Old Delhi mosque before blast, caught on CCTVCCTV cameras captured Dr Umar un Nabi entering and leaving the Faiz-e-Ilahi Mosque near Ramlila Maidan, opposite Turkman Gate, where he stayed for over 10 minutes before heading towards the Red Fort.

Is Gen Z the therapy generation that's emotionally liberated but too sensitive?Gen Z loves to talk about their emotions, but sometimes maybe a little too much. Does this emotional openness make them a bit too sensitive?

CIA dropped modified poppy seeds to weaken Afghan heroin trade: ReportThe Washington Post revealed the CIA secretly dropped modified poppy seeds over Afghanistan for a decade to weaken its opium trade, a covert operation that proved costly and largely ineffective.

The New Luxury: How Republic of Nature Redefines Meaningful Living on ECRDiscover how Republic of Nature by GTB Developers is reshaping Chennai's East Coast Road with design-forward homes that blend luxury, nature, and mindfulness in one of India's most refined new communities.

Video: Nithari killings accused Surendra Koli walks out of jail after acquittalSurendra Koli was released from the jail Wednesday night after he was acquitted by the Supreme Court in the last remaining murder case related to the infamous 2005-2006 Nithari killings in Noida, which drew widespread media attention.

Adah Sharma: Half the country wanted to protect me, other half wanted to kill meActor Adah Sharma spoke to IndiaToday.in about receiving death threats post 'The Kerala Story' and why she deems controversial roles necessary. She also discussed her upcoming legal thriller 'Reeta Sanyal Season 2'

SLC to take action against players considering leaving Pak after Islamabad blastThe Sri Lankan cricket board has warned its players of action who are thinking of pulling out of the ongoing Pakistan tour after a bomb blast in Islamabad. Several members of the Sri Lankan squad have informed their cricket board that they are unwilling to continue with the tour, citing security fears

'Wants to import third world': MAGA base revolts after Trump backs H-1B visaTrump's claim that America lacks enough  talented workers and his defense of H-1B visas sparked a fierce backlash from MAGA supporters, who accused him of abandoning his America First stance.

US House clears bill to end longest government shutdown, Trump to sign it soonCongress passed a deal ending the longest US government shutdown, restoring worker pay and services. The bill, backed by Trump, extends funding through January 30, reigniting partisan clashes over healthcare subsidies.

After Twinkle's viral cheating remark, Kajol says marriage should have expiry dateIn the finale of 'Two Much With Kajol and Twinkle', Kajol sparked a debate by suggesting marriages should have an expiry date and renewal option.

Live: Lal Quila Metro Station to remain closed until further notice due to security reasonsDelhi Red Fort Blast Live Updates: A powerful explosion ripped through a Hyundai i20 near Delhi's Red Fort Metro Station at around 6.50 pm on Monday, killing 12 people and injuring 20 others. The explosion took place in a slow-moving car that had stopped at a red light just outside the Red Fort metro station. Preliminary investigations suggest a coordinated terror attack, prompting authorities to invoke the UAPA in the FIR. The Union Cabinet on Wednesday officially classified the blast as a "terrorist act" carried out by "anti-national elements." The National Investigation Agency has assumed charge of the probe as security has been tightened and nationwide alerts remain in effect. Stay tuned to indiatoday.in for all the latest updates.

Bhopal model death: Family claims boyfriend hid religion, forced her to convertBhopal Police arrested Kasim Ahmad, boyfriend of model Khushbu Ahirwar, for allegedly forcing her to convert and altering her Aadhaar photo to show her in a burqa. The case has sparked outrage after Khushbu's mysterious death earlier this month.

Do US remarks on Delhi, Islamabad blasts reveal Trump's bias?The explosion in Delhi and the suicide blast in Islamabad triggered global reactions. But the US' responses to both the incidents have sparked a debate if America, under President Donald Trump, has a bias towards Pakistan. While Washington DC condemned the Islamabad attack as terrorism, it delayed its response to the Delhi blast, which had a neutral tone. The US' response didn't go unnoticed.

The Devil Wears Prada 2 drops teaser: Meryl Streep, Anne Hathaway return in MayThe sequel to the 2006 hit brings back Meryl Streep, Anne Hathaway and Emily Blunt to depict new power struggles at Runway magazine amid the decline of print journalism.

Delhi bomber's 2nd car, red EcoSport, found near Haryana village after massive huntRed EcoSport car owned by Delhi blast suspect was found parked in Haryana after cops launched massive hunt this afternoon. The car with DL10CK0458 plate was registered in the name of Umar Un Nabi at Rajouri Garden RTO on 22 November 2017.

Delhi blast suspect planned big strike on Babri Masjid demolition anniversaryDr Umar Nabi, the prime suspect of Monday's Red Fort blast, intended to carry out a major explosion around the Babri Masjid demolition anniversary on December 6, according to sources.

Narrow edge for NDA, Bihar staring at photo finish, predicts Axis My India exit pollBihar exit polls: The Axis My India exit poll has predicted a narrow win for the Nitish Kumar-led NDA in the Bihar elections, despite 20 years of anti-incumbency. The Tejashwi Yadav-led Mahagathbandhan is likely to secure 98-118 seats.

Rashmika Mandanna: Hope everyone has a Vijay Deverakonda in life, he's a blessingAt the success meet of 'The Girlfriend' in Hyderabad, Rashmika Mandanna expressed gratitude to Vijay Deverakonda, referring to him as "a blessing" and sharing her hopes that everyone has such a person in their lives.

Despite a midweek dip, steady audience turnout and positive word-of-mouth suggest the film could maintain its momentum into the second weekend.

sports.headline: ISL, I-League clubs to meet Sports Minister after failed talks with AIFF chief The crisis in Indian football escalated on Wednesday, landing at the doorstep of Sports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya after talks between the national federation and CEOs of Indian Super League (ISL) clubs failed to resolve the deadlock that has stalled the domestic circuit.

Tyre smoke, control: India's drift king Sanam Sekhon on his Guinness record ride India's very own Drift King, Sanam Sekhon, did the unthinkable when he pulled off the perfect drift to claim the Guinness World Record at the Umling La. Speaking to India Today, Sanam opens up on his journey, the legacy he wants to leave and more.

Rishabh Pant eyes Sehwag's historic India record in South Africa Tests: Stat Pack IND vs SA, Stat Pack: Rishabh Pant, Shubman Gill, Ravindra Jadeja and other Indian players will eye key milestones in the upcoming Test series against South Africa, starting November 14.

IPL 2026 retention prediction: How will CSK shape up after Jadeja-Samson trade? Chennai Super Kings hit their lowest point in the IPL, finishing at the bottom of the table for the first time. The five-time champions are now set for a major reset ahead of next season, with several gaps in the squad needing attention. The proposed trade of Ravindra Jadeja for Sanju Samson is also expected to reshape the team's balance and give CSK a fresh direction.

Not Ravindra Jadeja, Yashasvi Jaiswal should be RR captain: Aakash Chopra Aakash Chopra believes Rajasthan Royals should hand the captaincy to Yashasvi Jaiswal instead of Ravindra Jadeja. His comments come amid reports of a blockbuster trade between CSK and RR involving Jadeja, Curran, and Sanju Samson.

The tennis star credited her close friend, Bollywood director Farah Khan, for helping her through one of her lowest emotional moments.

Several members of the Sri Lankan squad have informed their cricket board that they are unwilling to continue with the tour, citing security fears

Haryana CM felicitates Shafali Verma with Rs 1.5 Crore prize for World Cup win Haryana Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini felicitated India's Women's World Cup-winning star Shafali Verma at his official residence in Chandigarh. Shafali played a pivotal role in India's World Cup triumph, being adjudged Player of the Match in the final for scoring 87 runs and taking two wickets.

Jasprit Bumrah and Kagiso Rabada will play big role in IND vs SA Tests: Greame Smith Graeme Smith feels Jasprit Bumrah and Kagiso Rabada could define the India-South Africa Test series. The former Proteas captain said both sides must handle pace early before spinners take charge in Kolkata.

No word from Rohit Sharma on availability for Vijay Hazare Trophy: MCA Official Mumbai Cricket Association officials state Rohit Sharma has not yet communicated his availability for the Vijay Hazare Trophy. The BCCI has reportedly urged senior players to participate in domestic cricket to remain in ODI contention.

The BCCI has reportedly urged senior players to participate in domestic cricket to remain in ODI contention.

Shardul Thakur to MI? R Ashwin accidentally reveals big trade move for IPL 2026Ravichandran Ashwin accidentally revealed Shardul Thakur's trade to Mumbai Indians ahead of the IPL 2026 retention deadline. Thakur played for Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) in IPL and scalped 13 wickets from ten games.

Hope India use New Zealand lessons vs spin-heavy South Africa: Ryan ten DoeschateIndia assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate expects India's batters to apply lessons from last year's New Zealand defeat as they face defending World Test champions South Africa. The two-match series begins Friday at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata.

Afghan cricketer Rashid Khan confirms second marriage, 10 months after firstAfghanistan cricket star Rashid Khan, who represents Gujarat Titans in the Indian Premier League (IPL), confirmed that he had married for a second time on August 2, 2025, just 10 months after his first marriage. His confirmation came after rumours sparked by charity event photos. Khan requested his privacy be respected.

Stokes responds to Botham's criticism over Ashes preps: Not sure what more we can doBen Stokes has dismissed Ian Botham's criticism over England's Ashes preparations, insisting the team has done everything possible despite a packed schedule. He sounded confident that England will be ready when the series begins.

David Beckham and Gary Neville set to land in India promoting Salford CityManchester United legends David Beckham and Gary Neville will visit India this November to promote their club Salford City. Their trip adds to a star-studded year for Indian football, with Lionel Messi also set to arrive soon.

Bumrah is the toughest to face, hope we don't see him in SA20: Faf du PlessisFaf du Plessis has hailed Jasprit Bumrah as the toughest bowler to face in the world. He also jokingly hoped that he would never get to face him in South Africa's premier T20 competition SA20.

Bangladesh dominate Ireland in Sylhet Test after Mahmudul Hasan Joy 169BAN vs IRE, 1st Test: Mahmudul Hasan Joy's unbeaten 169 and a record fourth-highest opening stand with Shadman Islam powered Bangladesh to 338 for 1, giving them a 52-run lead over Ireland in the Sylhet Test.

Nitish Kumar Reddy released from India Test squad for South Africa seriesIndia all-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy has been released from the Test squad ahead of the South Africa series. He will join India A in Rajkot to gain match time after recent injury setbacks.

Nitish Kumar Reddy released from India Test squad for South Africa seriesIndia all-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy has been released from the Test squad ahead of the South Africa series. He will join India A in Rajkot to gain match time after recent injury setbacks.

Rohit Sharma retains spot as No.1 ranked ODI batter, Virat Kohli jumps to fifthRohit Sharma retained the top spot in the ICC ODI batting rankings with 781 points after a stellar series against Australia, while Virat Kohli bounced back with a gritty 74. Shubman Gill ranked fourth, keeping India's batting dominance intact.

Babar Azam slumps to new low, drops out of ODI rankings top 5 for the first time in 6 yearsPAK vs SL: Babar Azam has fallen out of the top five of the ODI rankings for the first time in six years after he managed only 74 runs in his last four innings. On Tuesday, Babar scored only 29 runs before Wanindu Hasaranga accounted for his wicket.

Laura Wolvaardt named ICC Player of the Month for October after World Cup heroicsSouth Africa's Laura Wolvaardt and Senuran Muthuswamy have been named ICC Women's and Men's Players of the Month respectively for October. Wolvaardt was the highest run scorer of the Women's World Cup 2025, while Muthuswamy was the Player of the Series in the two-match Test rubber against Pakistan.

South Africa confident of history of our own in India: Head coach Shukri ConradIND vs SA, 1st Test: In the press conference before the Kolkata Test, South Africa head coach Shukri Conrad said that the Proteas have a potent spin attack and are more than capable of beating India in their upcoming Test series.

Security beefed up for Sri Lanka team after suicide bombing in IslamabadPakistan has ramped up security for the visiting Sri Lankan cricket team following recent militant attacks, deploying the army and paramilitary forces for protection. PCB chairman and Interior Minister Mohsin Naqvi personally assured the visitors of fool-proof safety.

IND vs SA: Dhruv Jurel to replace Nitish Reddy in Kolkata Test, Ten Doeschate confirmsIndia assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate confirmed Dhruv Jurel will play the first Test against South Africa in Kolkata. The wicketkeeper-batter's twin centuries against South Africa A secured his spot, while Nitish Reddy may miss out this week.

Superman: Shaheen Afridi in awe of Babar Azam's stunning catch vs Sri LankaPAK vs SL: Shaheen Shah Afridi hailed Babar Azam's stunning one-handed catch in the slips during the first ODI against Sri Lanka, calling it a "Superman" effort. However, Babar's struggles with the bat persisted, as he managed just 29 runs and extended his century drought to 83 innings.

Chelsea's Raheem Sterling and family safe after attempted home break-in: ReportChelsea forward Raheem Sterling and his family escaped unharmed after masked intruders attempted to break into their Berkshire home. The incident, Sterling's second in recent years, occurred on Saturday evening. Police have launched an investigation.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
